metadata.title: CVE-2017-6828 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the readValue function in FileHandle.cpp inaudiofile (aka libaudiofile and Audio File Library) 0.3.6 allows remoteattackers to have unspecified impact via a crafted WAV file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6828` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

audiofile-tools - 0.3.6-2ubuntu0.16.04.1
libaudiofile1 - 0.3.6-2ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: audiofile package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.3.6-2ubuntu0.16.04.1').
